dream: Ok so I went to sleep and dreamed that I was taking my college courses on a cruise ship. At first I was really good at taking my classes, but soon the days dragged on and I was struggling to focus on anything or get anything done. Then I met a boy who said he worked on this cruise ship his entire life, he looked Mexican but I think he was Indian. He said he was named after Krishna but that he didn't like the name because he is Christain, nor did he like the 100 something. While he was talking the ship was tipping and it overturned and drowned him, the liquid felt kind of real and I saw that he was dead, I reached out my hand to his so that he would not be alone. I knew I wasn't going to live and so I looked upward reminding myself of the resurrection. Then I woke up in my bed and my mom and aunt were trying to get me to choose which dinner to feed my brother and I kept having to remind myself I was asleep which would reset the dream.
interpretation:
This dream seems to reflect some underlying emotions and concerns you may have in your waking life.

The cruise ship symbolizes your journey through your college courses. Initially, you feel confident and competent, but as time progresses, you start to struggle and lose focus. This could suggest that you may be feeling overwhelmed or finding it difficult to stay motivated or engaged in your studies.

The boy you meet, who appears to be of mixed ethnicity, may represent diversity or unfamiliarity in your life. His conflicting identity, being named after Krishna but identifying as Christian, could reflect inner conflicts or confusion about your own beliefs or sense of self.

The ship tipping over and the boy drowning might symbolize a sense of chaos or instability in your life. It may feel overwhelming and difficult to navigate through challenging situations. Your reaching out to him could indicate your empathy and desire not to let others feel alone during difficult times.

Your awareness of your impending death in the dream and your thoughts about resurrection suggest a contemplation of life, death, and a potential renewal or rebirth. It may reflect a reminder to focus on the bigger picture and find strength and hope in the face of difficulties.

Finally, the transition to waking life and your interaction with your mom and aunt could represent a struggle between the dream world and reality. It may suggest that you are feeling torn between different responsibilities or expectations, and finding it challenging to fully engage in either.

Overall, this dream may be reflecting your subconscious worries or conflicts related to your college journey, identity, navigating challenges, and finding a balance between different aspects of your life.
title: "Cruising Through Chaos: A Dream of Struggling Academics, Mysterious Encounters, and Resurrection"

dream: This dream takes place in a Japanese-esque city setting. There's a small carnival/festival with rides and games, and everyone looks like they're having a good time. Besides all my immediate coworkers, my moms side of the family, and my boyfriend, I didn't recognize anyone else there. A particular area I kept walking past was a long street, wide like a boardwalk. Three shady individuals were tucked to the right side, and they were drug dealers. The other two seemed blurry and generic, but the main one I interacted with very detailed, though I've never seen him before. To the left was a nearby apartment/hotel room that I presume was for me and my family. If/when I entered the apartment/hotel, my family was having dinner inside. I remember bringing one of my coworkers inside the apartment. I never brought anyone out. At one point, I'm walking my boyfriend to the apartment, and he goes ahead of me. The detailed drug dealer beckons to me, asking if I want to buy some drugs, and I decline. This upsets him, and he grabs me. I started screaming for my boyfriend. He's not even looking. In fact, it looks like he's smiling at something. Somehow, I break free from the drug dealers grip, and I get away without taking any drugs. My boyfriend seemingly disappears. The dream takes an abrupt turn when a slow moving missile (that resembles a Japanese can of Coca-cola) In this point in the dream, I discover I'm on some sort of vacation, and the presence of a missle scared me enough where I wanted to go home. It cuts to me sitting at a red light in the same town. It's fairly normal until I start seeing objects slowly flying towards me. I try to tell myself it's a kite or something until I LITERALLY see the ferris wheel from the festival casually flying with people in it. I start looking around to see if people see what I see. I realize the light changed, and I'm sitting six car spaces away from the other cars on the road, so I hurry and turn left at the light. I'm frantically trying to leave the area, basically driving in circles, almost hitting scammers trying to get hit on purpose, and seeing more flying objects. I woke up shortly after.
interpretation:
This dream seems to reflect a mix of different emotions and situations in your life. The Japanese-esque city and carnival/festival setting suggest a sense of enjoyment and fun. Seeing your coworkers, family, and boyfriend indicates that these relationships hold significance to you.

The presence of drug dealers on one side of the street may symbolize a temptation or negative influence in your life. Your decision to decline their offer demonstrates your ability to resist such temptations. The fact that you bring one of your coworkers into the apartment suggests a desire for their approval or involvement in your personal life.

However, the unsettling moment when the drug dealer grabs you and your boyfriend's disengagement may represent a feeling of betrayal or disappointment in your relationship. Your boyfriend's disappearance could symbolize uncertainty or a lack of support in dealing with difficult situations.

The sudden appearance of a missile and the resulting fear indicate a desire for security and the longing for the comforts of home. The flying objects and chaotic scenes while you are sitting at the red light may reflect a sense of being overwhelmed or feeling out of control in your waking life.

The dream seems to suggest that you may be facing external influences or pressures that challenge your relationships, resilience, and ability to navigate difficult situations. It may be helpful to examine your life and relationships to identify any areas where you feel vulnerable or unsupported. Consider seeking support from loved ones or finding healthier ways to cope with challenges.
title: "Festival Frenzy: Escaping the Drug Dealers and Flying Ferris Wheels"

dream: In the first scene I'm at home with my mom and sister, in our dining room. We hear noises outside and I go out onto my deck to see my neighbors in their pool, with about a dozen others. They're holding what I'm guessing was glasses of champagne or wine, and the pool water was orange instead. My sister said it was probably because of the drinks. The pool wasn't big so they hardly had any space. It was a weird sight. In the next scene I'm at Walmart, the store, with my mom and sister, I'm not sure if my dad was there. My mom didn't seem happy and me and my sister were angry about something. We were in a almost closed off section where paintings were hung, and we were looking at them. But I left the area and walked around. Soon I realized I couldn't find my way back, and all the men around seemed very suspicious. I was lost. I tried to stay away from all the men, but soon ones that looked either old or homeless started trying to kidnap me. And there was one who seemed fine and young, but we got into a physical fight, I don't remember why. I was doing good but then my attacks stopped hurting him and my moves were slowing and weakening. But i got away. There was also a green man in a wheelchair after me, and he tried trapping me when I ran passed him. But I got away from him too. I wondered if my family had forgotten about me and left. I thought about checking the parking lot for their car but I didn't. At some point I think I saw my sister again, still angry, in the distance. We met up, but I must've lost her again somehow. Then I remembered I could just call them! So I asked a lady where the bathroom is, and she shows me, it was basically right in front of me and I didn't realize. So I went in and searched my bag for my phone, but took out an mp3 instead. And then I remembered: I didn't HAVE a phone. So I could not call them. Through out the dream I think I was switching between myself and Harry, a character from a TV show.
interpretation:
This dream appears to reflect feelings of disconnection, confusion, and vulnerability. The first scene in your dream, where you see your neighbors in a pool with orange water, suggests a sense of curiosity about others and a desire to be a part of their experiences. However, the limited space in the pool may symbolize feeling left out or excluded from certain social circles.

The second scene at Walmart highlights potential dissatisfaction within your family dynamic. Your mother appears unhappy, and you and your sister are angry about something. The section with paintings could represent a desire for creative expression or a search for beauty and meaning in your life. Getting lost in the store and encountering suspicious men may symbolize a lack of direction or feeling overwhelmed by external pressures. The attempted kidnappings represent a fear of losing control or being taken advantage of in some way.

The green man in the wheelchair could symbolize vulnerability or a perceived threat from unexpected sources. Feeling abandoned by your family and struggling to find them again may suggest a fear of being left alone or unsupported in challenging situations.

The inability to call your family due to not having a phone reflects a sense of helplessness and difficulty in reaching out for support or connection when needed. The mention of switching between yourself and a TV show character, Harry, could indicate a desire for escape or a struggle to separate reality from fiction.

Overall, this dream may reflect underlying feelings of insecurity, isolation, and the need for support and communication within your relationships and daily life. It may be beneficial to examine these emotions and consider ways to address them in order to find a sense of stability and fulfillment.
title: "Mysterious Pool and Suspicious Strangers: Lost in the Walmart Maze"

dream: i had a dream i seen the guy i'm talking to Jeff blocked me on everything and the next day i seen him dropping his friend Jamal off at his house and i was walking in the pouring rain while crying and he did nothing. a few hours later he messaged me saying he hoped i enjoyed my walk in the rain.
interpretation:
Dreams can often be highly personal and their meaning can vary based on individual circumstances and emotions. However, generally speaking, this dream could indicate feelings of vulnerability, abandonment, and potential power dynamics in your relationship with Jeff.

The dream starts with Jeff blocking you on everything, which may symbolize a sense of disconnection or distancing in your waking life. This action could represent barriers between the two of you, communication obstacles, or emotional detachment.

Seeing Jeff dropping off his friend Jamal could suggest that Jeff is prioritizing other people or areas of his life over you. It might evoke a feeling of being left behind or neglected. Walking in the pouring rain while crying could reflect your emotional turmoil and helplessness in dealing with these negative emotions.

Jeff not taking any action to help you in the dream could signify a lack of support or empathy from him in your real-life relationship. It may hint that he is not meeting your emotional needs or providing the comfort you desire.

The message Jeff sends later in the dream, saying he hopes you enjoyed your walk in the rain, could emphasize a sense of insensitivity or disregard for your feelings. It may suggest that he is unaware or unsympathetic to your emotional distress.

Overall, this dream could reflect your subconscious fears and anxieties about your relationship with Jeff. It might be a sign that you should evaluate the dynamics between you two and consider whether your emotional needs are being met. Communication and open dialogue with Jeff could help address these concerns and bring clarity to your waking life situation.
title: "Alone in the Rain: Betrayed by Jeff, Ignored in Tears"

dream:
I had a dream that I was in a university studying chemistry. I walked out of class since the professor asked me to getcmu uniform. There I met my old teacher, I was catching up with her and there was a small accident where water is leaking out of a pipe. Then I asked her to leave because of her safety and proceeded to get my uniform. There the tailor gave me a Chino pants a pink formal shirt a black t-shirt with a picture on it a pair of socks a scarf and pink canvas shoes. I accidentally dropped the scarf into a puddle and picked it up amd proceeded to class.  There I changed my shoes ans I was given a test which I'm supposed to take. I was looking for a place to sit and found a place in the back. Earlier when I first entered the class I had 3 glasses with some drink in it, after finishing the drink and while I was out getting my uniform 2 glasses broke and the shot glass remained untouched. When I found a spot at the last bench in the class the professor showed up as I was struggling to find the question and asked me exchange seats wuth Uchiha itachis. Then I discovered that I had broken glass in my mouth. No matter how much I spit out it keeps coming. While this is happening theres a guest lecturer in the class talking about something. Now I start looking for my shoes so I can to to the men's room and spit out the glass, but I can't find my shoes and socks. After a few minutes of searching I find them but the socks looks misplaced. I find a pair of brown socks and a single white sock.
I walk out of the class holding my shoes and sit at the lobby trying to wear them and the place shifted to a living room with my relatives playing with dogs. I woke up after this
interpretation:
The dream you described seems to suggest a sense of struggle and chaos in your life. Being in a university studying chemistry could symbolize a desire for knowledge and understanding. Walking out of class upon the professor's request to get a uniform may represent a need to conform or follow certain expectations.

Meeting your old teacher and the accident with the leaking pipe could symbolize reconnecting with past influences or experiences that have left an emotional impact. Asking your teacher to leave for her safety and getting your uniform could indicate a focus on personal growth and taking care of yourself.

The items given to you by the tailor, such as the Chino pants, pink formal shirt, black t-shirt, socks, scarf, and shoes, may symbolize aspects of your identity and self-expression. The accidental dropping of the scarf into a puddle could signify a disruption or setback in your self-image or confidence.

Changing shoes and being given a test in class may represent adapting to new circumstances or challenges in your waking life. Struggling to find a place to sit and exchanging seats with Uchiha Itachi could symbolize a desire for stability or a need to establish your position or role in a certain situation.

Discovering broken glass in your mouth suggests difficulties in communication or expressing yourself. The inability to spit out the glass may symbolize feeling trapped or unable to fully express your thoughts and emotions.

Searching for your shoes and socks could represent a search for stability or a sense of groundedness in your life. The misplaced socks, specifically the pair of brown socks and single white sock, may symbolize a feeling of not quite fitting in or being out of place.

The shift to a living room with relatives playing with dogs in the lobby may represent a need for comfort and connection with loved ones. Overall, this dream suggests a need for balance, self-reflection, and finding a sense of stability amidst chaos or change.
title: "Chemistry Class Mishaps: Leaking Pipes, Lost Shoes, and Broken Glass"

dream: I dreamed that I was dating someone, but it was also trying to escape from them in a castle and not let them know that I was trying to escape, to let them think that they were coming with me. But they were chasing me like an enemy and I had to trick them. And there was other monsters in the castle that I was trying to escape. And I was repeating it twice from memory. And I had powers to jump and bounce acrobatically over obstacles. And the guy had really long arms that could reach across caverns and try to catch me with sticky arms.  He trusted me at first that I was not trying to escape him but then he started to doubt me, as I was at the exit. We ran into friends who were just starting to explore the castle, and that's where he got confused. I had to keep the ruse up and escape him.
interpretation:
This dream is likely related to feelings of being trapped or suffocated in a relationship or situation in your waking life. The castle represents a confined space, symbolizing the constraints of the relationship. Your desire to escape from the person you're dating reflects a deep need for personal freedom and independence. The monsters in the castle represent various obstacles or challenges that you're trying to avoid or overcome. Your ability to jump and bounce acrobatically signifies your resourcefulness and resilience in navigating difficult situations.

The long arms of the guy chasing you with sticky arms may represent his attempts to control or manipulate you, making it difficult for you to break free. His initial trust in you and subsequent doubt reflects the dynamic of trust and suspicion within the relationship. Running into friends who are exploring the castle suggests external influences or perspectives that are influencing the situation.

Overall, this dream signifies your desire to escape a suffocating relationship while maintaining a façade or preserving the relationship's appearance. It may be a reflection of the struggle between your personal freedom and the fear of hurting or disappointing others. It's important to recognize your own needs and emotions in order to make decisions that align with your own happiness and well-being.
title: "The Deceptive Castle Escape: Tricking Love and Evading Sticky Arms in Dreamland"

dream: The other night I had a dream where one of my front teeth was wiggly and wanting to fall out. Then, all of my teeth fell out. I woke up relieved that it was just a dream. Last night, I dreamed of my brother and grandma who I didn’t grow up with. We were going to this restaurant and when we went in, I saw it was empty and the food didn’t look fresh and the store was empty, so we walked out. Then I suggested we go to another nearby restaurant that I knew was tried and true, so we ended up eating there. I remember vaguely eating at the place, but I don’t think me brother and grandma were with me anymore, it was with another group of people. We had Korean bbq at a place in real life that isn’t that type of restaurant. After that we ended up back at the other restaurant and I ended up placing an order I didn’t know about so then I had to pay for it and even left a tip, even though I didn’t know I ordered anything. The place was actually pretty busy when we came back, too. That’s all I remember.
interpretation:
The dream about your teeth falling out is a common symbol of anxiety and insecurity. It may indicate that you are worried about losing control or experiencing a loss of power in some aspect of your life. It could also reflect a fear of aging or the passage of time.

The second dream involving your brother and grandmother suggests a desire for connection and a longing for familial bonds. The empty restaurant and stale food could represent a feeling of disappointment or dissatisfaction in your relationships or experiences. The suggestion to go to another restaurant highlights your ability to find alternatives and make better choices.

Eating Korean BBQ with a different group of people might symbolize your willingness to explore new experiences and social circles. However, the confusion around the order and paying for something you didn't know about reflects a sense of being taken advantage of or being unaware of all the consequences of your choices.

Overall, these dreams may indicate that you are grappling with feelings of insecurity, a longing for connection, and a need to navigate choices more consciously. It could be beneficial to reflect on these themes in your waking life and consider how you can address and improve upon these areas.
title: "Wiggly Teeth and Culinary Adventures: Dreaming with Lost Relatives and a Confusing Restaurant Experience"

dream: I'm somehow back at high school, in a class talking to a teacher while we wait for class to start. I realize that I accidentally have my gun in my waistband, and I get nervous about being caught and labeled a criminal. I choose to leave the school, as I'm not required to be there seeing as I graduated in 2011. I walk home, which in this dream is near the waterfront. Passing some restaurants, I hear gunshots. I still have my gun on me, but I choose to run as opposed to playing the hero. I run off, and end up in a fenced in park at dark, and I have to wedge myself under the fence to get out. Continuing back towards home, I see men with guns, the ones who were shooting earlier. They are holding people hostage. This time, I draw my gun and fire. Time seems to slow down, and my shot hits the gunman in the forehead. He goes down, but gets back up and shakes the cops hand. Apparently it was an elaborate joke on me. I don't understand how my bullet didn't actually harm him, but I continue home. After getting turned around, I try to use an app on my phone that would teleport me home, but it isn't working. Eventually I find my house. I go in to find it trashed, with ants infesting the place, so I vacuum them up.
interpretation:
This dream appears to be a reflection of your inner fears, anxieties, and unresolved issues. Being back in high school suggests that you may be experiencing feelings of regression or a longing for the past. The presence of a gun in your waistband implies a hidden or dangerous aspect of yourself that you are trying to suppress or hide. It represents a potential for violence or harm, which you fear being discovered for and labeled a criminal.

Leaving the school and walking home near the waterfront can symbolize your desire to escape from a current situation or to distance yourself from the past. The gunshots you hear while passing restaurants evoke a sense of danger and chaos in your environment. Choosing to run away instead of confronting the situation suggests a tendency to avoid conflict and seek safety.

Finding yourself in a fenced park at night represents feeling trapped in a difficult or challenging situation. Wedging yourself under the fence suggests the need to find creative solutions to overcome obstacles in your life. Encountering the gunmen holding people hostage reveals your awareness of the presence of threats or negative influences in your surroundings.

When you draw your gun and fire at the gunman, it symbolizes your desire to defend yourself and take control of the situation. However, the fact that your bullet doesn't harm him and it turns out to be an elaborate joke on you suggests a feeling of powerlessness or a lack of control in your waking life. This may indicate that you often feel deceived or manipulated by others.

The failed attempt to teleport home using your phone app represents your longing for a quick fix or an easy escape from your current circumstances. Its malfunction implies that there are no easy solutions to your problems and that you need to face them directly.

Finally, discovering your trashed house infested with ants represents feelings of disorder, turmoil, and dissatisfaction in your personal life. Vacuuming them up symbolizes your attempt to regain control and eliminate the nuisances or challenges that are bothering you.

Overall, this dream suggests that you may be dealing with unresolved fears, a desire for escapism, a lack of control, and a need to confront and overcome the obstacles in your waking life.
title: "High School Secrets: Gunfire, Heroes, and Teleportation Mishaps"

dream: I had a dream that my boyfriend and i were in thailand and told me he already bought a ticket home and told me to buy one as well. and it was strange that he didn't tell me he was buying a ticket so i understood that he had an idea to go home alone and not tell me but because he told me it meant that for some reason he changed his mind. it was alarming and felt unsafe. then i left and started walking through some private people yards. there were a lot of farm animals, like goats. Then i walked into a geese yard and one goose bit my ankle. I had to open it's beak with force. Then in front of me was a fence and i had to get to the other side. so I decided to fly over (somehow it was clear for me that i can fly because a goose bit me). So i started moving my arms and i flew. I saw my boyfriend on the ground and he saw me amazed that i can fly. The feeling of flying was amazing
interpretation:
This dream suggests some underlying feelings of insecurity and an imbalance of power in your relationship. The setting of Thailand may symbolize a sense of adventure or new experiences. The fact that your boyfriend already bought a ticket home and instructed you to do the same without prior discussion implies a lack of communication or consideration for your feelings and desires. This causes you to feel unsafe and uncertain about the direction of the relationship.

The presence of farm animals like goats signifies simplicity and grounding, while the geese represent assertiveness and protection. The goose biting your ankle could symbolize a conflict or a force that challenges you. Opening the goose's beak with force suggests that you are actively dealing with the obstacles or challenges in your life.

The act of flying represents a sense of freedom, control, and empowerment. It suggests that you have the ability to rise above difficult situations and gain a new perspective on your relationship. Your boyfriend's amazement at seeing you fly could signify a newfound admiration or realization of your strength and independence.

Overall, this dream may be reflecting your subconscious concerns about your relationship and the need for open communication, trust, and a balanced dynamic. It also highlights your resilience and ability to navigate challenging situations on your own.
title: "Thailand's Surprise Departure: Bewildering Flight & Feathered Encounter"

dream: I saw a bright light and heard a voice say compassion, patience, kindness and abundance. Then I saw a little girl faintly in the light and she told me to be more gentle while handing me a chamomile flower and I tucked it behind my ear
interpretation:
In this dream, the bright light represents spiritual guidance or enlightenment entering your life. The voice speaking about compassion, patience, kindness, and abundance suggests that these qualities are important for you to embrace and cultivate in your waking life. 

The appearance of the little girl symbolizes innocence, purity, and vulnerability. She represents a part of yourself that desires tenderness and gentleness. Her message to be more gentle indicates that you may need to approach situations and people with greater sensitivity and understanding.

The chamomile flower given to you by the little girl is a symbol of calmness, relaxation, and healing. Tucking it behind your ear suggests that you are receptive to this message and willing to embrace a more gentle and compassionate attitude.

Overall, this dream is encouraging you to incorporate compassionate and patient behaviors into your interactions with others and to cultivate an atmosphere of kindness and abundance in your life. It indicates a need for emotional healing and a reminder to be more gentle in your approach towards yourself and others.
title: "Enlightened Whispers: A Lesson in Gentle Abundance from a Little Girl"
